result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant regarding missed court date
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture hearing. Bond set 8/9/2022.

Defendant Kenneth H George not in court.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant to issue, bond forfeited. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt:
DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH (already posted)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.D.T. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Kenneth H George in court. JJ Crawford for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Motion to modify bond by Defendant, argument, granted. Defendant asking for 45 days out due to work schedule. $1000 to be refunded to person who posted. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*See new bond set 8/9/22*
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.D.T. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
